Lopinavir.Definition: Lopinavir (ABT-378) is an antiretroviral of the protease inhibitor class. It is marketed by Abbott as Kaletra, a co-formulation with a sub-therapeutic dose of ritonavir, as a component of combination therapy to treat HIV/AIDS. Pharmacology: Lopinavir is an antiretroviral of the protease inhibitor class. Mechanism of action: Lopinavir inhibits the HIV viral proteinase enzyme which prevents cleavage of the gag-pol polyprotein, resulting in noninfectious, immature viral particles. Drug type: Approved. Small Molecule. Drug category: Anti-HIV Agents. HIV Protease Inhibitors
